metadata.title: CVE-2022-41721 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
A request smuggling attack is possible when using MaxBytesHandler. Whenusing MaxBytesHandler, the body of an HTTP request is not fully consumed.When the server attempts to read HTTP2 frames from the connection, it willinstead be reading the body of the HTTP request, which could beattacker-manipulated to represent arbitrary HTTP2 requests.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-41721` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-golang-x-net-dev - 1:0.7.0+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: golang-golang-x-net package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:0.7.0+dfsg-1').
